headline.main: STATE AFFAIRS; A Budget of Petitions and Another of Bills. ASSESSMENT AND COLLECTION OF TAXES. THE NEW-YORK VOLUNTEERS. NEW-YORK TAX BILLS--FIRE MARSHAL. CHANCERY FUNDS.. AND A VARIETY OF OTHER THINGS.

docs.lead_paragraph: In the Assembly, a perfect torrent of petitions were presented, coming from all quarters of the 'State, and for all sorts of measures, from the Albany Bridge to the adjustment of private claims. A very large number of bills were reported from the Committees, which will give the Committee of the Whole business for many days to come We see progress at last.

docs.lead_paragraph: ASYLUM FOR INEBRIATES.--A petition is before the Massachusetts Legislature, praying for the establishment of an Asylum for inebriates, wherein they may receive such treatment as shall restore them to soundness of health and sanity of mind;
docs.snippet: ASYLUM FOR INEBRIATES.--A petition is before the Massachusetts Legislature, praying for the establishment of an Asylum for inebriates, wherein they may receive such treatment as shall restore them to soundness of health and sanity of mind;

headline.main: Are our Public Schools Injuring the Bodies of Our Children?

docs.lead_paragraph: The following will seem like a heresy in the ears of some, but to us it roads like--if not "Gospel," at least "Physiological Truth." We cram our boys; we stuff our children. We swathe them in iron rules, and do our prettiest to make "stupids" of them, Posterity will give us "fits" for our folly, if is has sense enough left to discover the cause of the damage we are doing it.
docs.snippet: The following will seem like a heresy in the ears of some, but to us it roads like--if not "Gospel," at least "Physiological Truth." We cram our boys; we stuff our children. We swathe them in iron rules, and do our prettiest to make "stupids" of...

docs.lead_paragraph: The Academy of Medicine moves a reform that is much needed. The "Health Department" of our City, as at present managed, makes us a laughing stock. All thinking men concur in demanding a change--it could scarcely be for the worse.
docs.snippet: The Academy of Medicine moves a reform that is much needed. The "Health Department" of our City, as at present managed, makes us a laughing stock. All thinking men concur in demanding a change--it could scarcely be for the worse.

headline.main: AFFAIRS IN KANSAS.; The Anticipated Invasion from Missouriaus --Watch and Ward still kept in Lawrence--Intense Cold Weather--General News.

docs.lead_paragraph: There is but little to write you about; still you want to know the most of it, owing to the general anxiety felt at this time concerning our affairs. There have been no further outrages upon our citizens, and all seems comparatively quiet along the border.

headline.main: NEBRASKA.; The New-York Times in Nebraska--The Legislature--A Few Ideas on Nebraska as we find it--General News, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: A few days since a number of copies of the NEW-YORK TIMES reached the Territory, containing some letters from "Jake." They, of course, created a sensation. Those to whom the letters alluded condemned them for stating facts, but they were upheld by the people--who, by the way, profess to rule here--and the statements made by "Jake" were voted "all right" and true.

headline.main: STATE AFFAIRS.; GENERAL ORDERS IN THE ASSEMBLY. REPORT OF THE DRY DOCK COMPANY. Nursery for Poor Children. GENERAL ORDERS IN THE ASSEMBLY. A CONVENTION. Hammond Silenced--How it was Done. POWERS OF NEW-YORK SUPERVISORS.

docs.lead_paragraph: It Was "General Order" day again in the Assembly, this morning, and more than usually stupid. The only bill of interest discussed was that providing, by an appropriation of $500, for the erection of a suitable monument to the memory of DAVID WILLIAMS. The bill was ordered to a third reading.

byline.original: Special Correspondence of the N. Y. Daily Times

headline.main: ARRIVAL OF THE ST. LOUIS.; Over a Million on Freight from California. Our Caifornia and Oregon Correspondence. ATTEMPTED REVOLUTION IN NEW-GRENADA. Serious Riot in Aspinwall. NEWS FROM THE SOUTH PACIFIC. VERY LATE FROM AUSTRALIA. AFFAIRS IN CALIFORNIA. San Francisco After Five Years' Absence--An Exhausted Treasury--Business--The Mines--The Senatorial Question--The Trial of Core--Arrival of Troops for Oregon--Reinforcements for Walker. Cold Weather--New-Year's inOregon--Return of Col. Kelley--Public Ovation to the Hero of Walla-Walla--Gen. Wool at a Discount--Politics. NEW-GRANADA. Revolutionary Movements in the State of Panama. Riot in Aspinwall. Steam to Australia. Miscellaneous News. SOUTH AMERICA. News from Chili-Railroads-lBusiuess In the Dlines-Great Fire in Valparaiso-Treaty with the United States-News from Peru and Ecuador. Chilian Treaty with the United States. Chilian Treaty with Great Britain. Maritime Intelligence. Peru. THE VERY LATEST FROM THE SOUTH PACIFIC. AUSTRALIA.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship St. Louis, Capt. A C. CnosKE, arrived last evening from AspinwalL We are indebted to the various Express Companies for late papers and intelligence. We are indebted to Mr. CHARBLS EL Novas, PursOr of the XS Lotue, for the following synopsis of her trip since leaving New-York: Jan. 21, 2 P. 1., left New-York for Aspinwall. Jan. 24. Passed ship George Law, bound North.

headline.main: IMPORTANT FROM THE FEJEE ISLANDS.; Burning of Five Fejee Towns by the U. S. Ship John Adams. The Savages Severely Punished-Their Frightful Cruelties. Ratification of a Treaty with the King of the Islands. List of Officers of the United States Ship John Adam. Some Account of the Fejee Savages--Their Ferocity--Massacres--Appearance of the John Adams at the Islands.

docs.lead_paragraph: By the arrival of the St. Louis from Aspinwall we have received important intelligence from the Fejee Islands. We take the following from the Panama Star and Herald of Feb. 5: The United States sloop-of-war John Adams, E. B. BOUTWELL Commander, arrived at this port carly on Sunday morning, (3d February,) from the Fejee Islands, via Valparaiso.
docs.abstract: Commanding the "John Adams" in operations agt. Fejees
